alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 10:10AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Bradford and northwestern Wyoming Counties through 1100 AM EDT... At 1010 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of New Albany, or 13 miles southwest of Wyalusing, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilmot, Hollenback, Wyalusing, Laceyville, New Albany, Lovelton, Sugar Run, South Branch, Cherrytown and Terrytown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
